page.title: 01EAST HADDON A GENERAL VIEW.
page.content: East Haddon is a small rural village situated 8 miles from Northampton,11 miles from Rugby and 15 miles from Market Harborough.Mentioned in the original Domesday survey the village had grown slowly until the twentieth century. This has seen a major change and the size of the village has doubled. There have been a number of council houses built together with 4 small private estates. The population today is largely professional with a disproportionate number being involved in education.The majority of older buildings are of local sandstone a soft and unsuitable building material.Modern buildings are either from reconstituted stone blocks or pale brick.Future development is limited by the inadequacy of the village sewers.
